Thousands of professionally-driven students from an array of life paths choose to enroll in our programs and leave satisfied, having earned a reputable and valuable degree. For this reason, we would love for you to come experience the NYU community for yourself.   Get to know our student body in person. Meet with our admissions staff about our wide range of programs. Tour our LEED-certified building. Wander through the tree-lined cobblestone streets on campus. Give in to the creative energy of the city.   Simply contact the Office of Admissions to arrange a time. We look forward to finding out more about you.            NYU School of Professional Studies Locations        The NYU School of Professional Studies classes are held at four convenient locations listed below. The location at 7 East 12th Street also houses the Office of Admissions. Thousands of professionally-driven students from an array of life paths choose to enroll in our programs and leave satisfied, having earned a reputable and valuable degree. For this reason, we would love for you to come experience the NYU community for yourself.   Get to know our student body in person. Meet with our admissions staff about our wide range of programs. Tour our LEED-certified building. Wander through the tree-lined cobblestone streets on campus. Give in to the creative energy of the city.   Simply contact the Office of Admissions to arrange a time. We look forward to finding out more about you.            NYU School of Professional Studies Locations        The NYU School of Professional Studies classes are held at four convenient locations listed below. The location at 7 East 12th Street also houses the Office of Admissions. Thousands of professionally-driven students from an array of life paths choose to enroll in our programs and leave satisfied, having earned a reputable and valuable degree. For this reason, we would love for you to come experience the NYU community for yourself.   Get to know our student body in person. Meet with our admissions staff about our wide range of programs. Tour our LEED-certified building. Wander through the tree-lined cobblestone streets on campus. Give in to the creative energy of the city.   Simply contact the Office of Admissions to arrange a time. We look forward to finding out more about you.            NYU School of Professional Studies Locations        The NYU School of Professional Studies classes are held at four convenient locations listed below. The location at 7 East 12th Street also houses the Office of Admissions.       The NYU School of Professional Studies Building at 7 East 12th Street   The Washington Square campus in Greenwich Village   The Midtown Graduate Center at 11 West 42nd Street   The Woolworth Building at 15 Barclay Street in downtown Manhattan     Please refer to the NYU campus map [PDF] for a more detailed view of our locations.             Expand All   Collapse All          7 East 12th Street        The NYU School of Professional Studies building at 7 East 12th Street serves as the on-campus home for the School's administrative offices and programs listed below. Take a PATH train to the 14th Street Station.   By Bus  From Broadway, take the No. 1 or 3 bus to the 5th Av-W. 12th stop.             Woolworth Building (15 Barclay Street)        15 Barclay Street, (the historic Woolworth Building), houses administrative offices, and classroom facilities for the programs listed below. The NYU School of Professional Studies occupies the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th floor of the building. All students need a valid NYU ID to enter; all visitors may register at the desk in the lobby. By Bus  From Broadway, take the No. 5 bus to the City Hall stop.               Washington Square Campus        Many NYU School of Professional Studies classes meet on the Washington Square campus, the center of NYU in the heart of Greenwich Village. One of the City's most creative and energetic communities, the Village is an historic neighborhood that has attracted generations of writers, musicians, artists, and intellectuals.   At This Location     The Paul McGhee Division (select courses)   M.S. in Fundraising and Grantmaking     Getting Here   By Subway  Take the 6 line to the Astor Place stop. Take the 1 line to the Christopher Street-Sheridan Square stop. From Grand Central Terminal, take the 6 subway line to the Astor Place stop.  Take a PATH train to the 9th Street and Avenue of the Americas Station. NYU Midtown Center (11 West 42nd Street)        At 11 West 42nd Street (the NYU Midtown Center), the NYU School of Professional Studies occupies the 4th, 5th, and 10th floors. Facilities include classrooms, graduate academic department and administrative offices, and the Brause Real Estate Library. The Midtown Center also features a café and a computer lab. All students need a valid NYU ID to enter; all visitors must register at the desk in the lobby.
